titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Last night the heat was exhausting, though rain fell heavily almost without intermission. I had a miserable time, and started the day in a very dilapidated condition.
Before breakfast I wrote to Jimmie, who is now at the Castle with the other Ordination candidates.

He is something more than disposed to approve the Archbishop's ill–starred action during the Strike: but he is constitutionally incapable of seeing any economic or social issue in due perspective: and his political prejudices are as potent as they are for the most part unreasonable. Nevertheless, he is a very loveable creature.
